intro: Astrocaryum gratum, commonly known as the golden palm or yellow palm, is a species of flowering plant in the Arecaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical rainforest environments. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate leaves that can reach several meters in length. Its fruit is a bright yellow, edible drupe that is used in traditional medicine and cuisine. The botanical features of Astrocaryum gratum make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
